Language.name: en
Language.Text:
We don't get it. Not even a little. For example, now we have to find 8 keys, and to achieve that we have to solve 8 puzzles... but what sense does this make? Why did the Proteans build it? If they were trying to protect from some scary enemy, wouldn't it be easier to just build real strong walls and cannons?
Maybe they wanted to hide in the Labyrinth, maybe they couldn't fight directly.
To build such an extensive Labyrinth must have been very demanding, even for the Proteans.
There must have been some fundamental reason: What's the purpose of the Labyrinth?
